I am trying to install cantera 1.6.0 on a SUN (sparc-sun-solaris2.10).

I a=
m having two problems:

1. The python installation is /usr/local/bin/python=
.  There is no
"python2" installation.   However, the config/configure scri=
pt always
tries to "preset" the python command to "/usr/bin/python2" - whic=
h
does not exist.  I have modified the config/configure file to
hard-code t=
his to PYTHON_CMD=3Dpython, and that works.  However, this is
not an ideal =
solution.  I have also tried specifying
PYTHON_CMD:=3D"/usr/local/bin/pytho=
n" in the configure file (in the base
directory).  This does not work.

2. =
I have "install" available as /usr/sbin/install and /etc/install. 
Cantera =
ignores these and instead tries to use the config/install-sh,
but the paths=
 to this that get generated in the makefiles as well as
the bin/install_tsc=
 file are all wrong.  The only work-around I have
found for that is to crea=
te soft-links to config/install-sh in several
places.  This is also not a g=
ood solution.

Any suggestions?

I haven't had problems installing on linux=
...

Thanks,

James
